articles.title: Alibaba (BABA) Sets New AI Benchmark with Qwen2.5-Omni-7B Multimodal Model!
articles.author: Niloy Chakrabarti
articles.summary: Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE:BABA) ranks 1st on our list of top AI ratings and news updates on Wall Street's radar. North Korea's Kim Jong Un oversaw tests of newly developed AI-powered suicide drones and called for increased production. Alabama Governor Kay Ivey banned Chinese AI tools over data security concerns. Bill Gates is optimistic about the benefits of AI.

articles.title: How to stay safe from cybercriminals using AI to clone your voice
articles.author: Victoria Kellogg
articles.summary: AI is constantly advancing, leading to the development of voice cloning technologies. Cybercriminals are using these tools to exploit AI voice cloning to impersonate family members, friends, or trusted individuals to trick victims into sending money or information. To protect yourself from cybercriminals, verify the caller and call the number you have for the person the scammer claims to be.

articles.title: Elon Musk sells X to his own xAI for $33 billion in all-stock deal
articles.author: Eastidahonews.Com Staff
articles.summary: Elon Musk has sold social media site X to his own xAI artificial intelligence company in a $33 billion all-stock deal. Musk bought the site then called Twitter for $44 billion in 2022, gutted its staff and changed its policies. He launched xAI a year later.

articles.title: The Algorithmic Scalpel: Will AI Truly Eradicate Incurable Diseases?
articles.author: Altaf Moti
articles.summary: In the digital age, artificial intelligence is being used as a powerful tool in the fight against incurable diseases. The future of AI in healthcare is not just to treat diseases but to prevent them from occurring in the first place. Ethical issues such as informed consent and algorithmic accountability must be carefully addressed to ensure that AI is used responsibly.

articles.title: Take a deep dive into the role of AI in education
articles.author: Christine Huard • Times
articles.summary: The AI Show @ ASU+GSV is a three-day deep dive into AI and education taking place April 5-7 at the San Diego Convention Center. More than 10,000 educators, workforce leaders, EdTech companies, innovators and AI explorers from more than 110 countries are expected to attend the summit. Secretary of Education Linda McMahon is a featured guest.

articles.title: Take a deep dive into the expanding role of AI in education at ASU+GSV in San Diego
articles.author: Christine Huard • Times
articles.summary: The AI Show @ ASU+GSV takes place April 5-7 at the San Diego Convention Center. It features more than 100 companies considered to be innovators in AI in education and speakers from the 'pre-K to gray' education and skills sector. Secretary of Education Linda McMahon is a featured guest.

articles.title: Bloomberg's use of AI summaries for its articles leads to numerous corrections
articles.author: Brad Matthews
articles.summary: Bloomberg News used artificial intelligence-generated summaries for its articles in January. Google search reveals at least 20 instances of stories where the summaries had to be removed after publication. Two articles on President Donald Trump's tariff policy were taken down this week, one for a lack of attribution on when tariffs were due to kick in and another for unspecified 'inaccuracy'

articles.title: Safeguard Nurses and Patients From Negative Impacts of AI
articles.author: Tiffany White
articles.summary: Bill Cassidy is the Chair of the Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor & Pensions. He needs to create a national framework for the use of artificial intelligence in nursing. There is no federal regulation for AI in clinical settings, which leaves hospitals free to prioritize cost-cutting and profit over patient care.

articles.title: When Will AI Drive Sustained GDP Growth Over 5% Per Year?
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: The Epoch AI research team focuses on the future of AI. They have disagreement about timelines for AGI. The value of AI will be driven by broad economic deployment. The primary economic impact of AI is its ability to broadly automate labor. New generation of AI models will be trained on around 100K H100s with 8-bit quantization.

articles.title: Koninklijke Philips N.V. (PHG): Leading Medical Tech Patents with 1,231 Applications in 2024

The US Food and Drug Administration cleared some of its AI tools integrated into EPIQ CVx and Affiniti CVx ultrasound systems.

articles.title: CGI Inc. (GIB): Expanding AI Capabilities with Momentum Technologies Acquisition
articles.author: Abdul Rahman

articles.title: Oklo Inc. (OKLO): Nuclear Energy Innovator Targets Data Center AI Boom
articles.author: Abdul Rahman
articles.summary: Oklo Inc. (NYSE:OKLO) is a leading developer of advanced nuclear reactors. It builds, owns, and operates power plants, benefiting from the growing demand for clean energy to power data centers amid the AI boom. The company has returned 373.4% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 218%. It has 27 hedge funds as shareholders.

articles.title: Europe's Most Valuable Company: Behind the Scenes
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: A group of 30 people got a firsthand look behind the curtain at SAP headquarters in Walldorf last week. They learned about how the company is leveraging artificial intelligence to transform industries. The visit was organized by Andrea Sauer, Global VP Business Change at SAP, in collaboration with 'Make IT in Schramberg' and the 'KI Impact Group.'

articles.title: 2 "Magnificent Seven" AI Stocks to Buy on the Dip
articles.author: Prosper Junior Bakiny
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) might be the best investment opportunity in years, perhaps in decades. Many AI-adjacent companies have been on fire for the past two years, but recently they took a bit of a dive due to industry-specific issues. Market wide headwinds have played a key role in the recent dip. Apple and Microsoft are excellent buy-and-hold options even with market caps near $3 trillion. Apple was a latecomer in AI, but it has several strengths that could allow it to make noise in AI.

articles.title: Why businesses judge AI like humans — and what that means for adoption
articles.summary: As businesses rush to develop AI, they are entering an implicit 'emotional contract' when they choose an AI product. Joy Liu has worked at AI startups and cloud and AI initiatives at Microsoft. She advises businesses to set up a testing process and set up weekly meetings with the tech vendor.

articles.title: Why businesses judge AI like humans — and what that means for adoption
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: As businesses rush to adopt AI, they're discovering that their subconscious requirements go far beyond the conventional software evaluation standards. Businesses signing an AI contract aren't just entering into a 'utility contract' seeking cost reduction or revenue growth anymore. They're entering an implicit 'emotional contract' often without realizing it.

articles.title: Bill Gates Makes Bold Prediction About the Future
articles.author: Effie Orfanides
articles.summary: Bill Gates believes that AI will replace doctors, teachers and other professionals within 10 years time. In recent years, the use of AI has been increasing in various areas. Elon Musk started a company called xAI and created a chatbot called "Grok" that is integrated on X. Musk announced that he sold X (formerly Twitter) to his xAI.

articles.title: Bill Gates says AI will eliminate most jobs except for coders, energy experts and biologists
articles.author: Rhoda
articles.summary: Bill Gates predicts that over the next decade, advances in artificial intelligence will mean that humans will no longer be needed 'for most things' in the world. He named three occupations that AI will not be able to replace: coders, energy experts and biologists. The Globalists' agenda is to monitor and control everything and everyone.

articles.title: Bill Gates Says AI Will Replace Doctors, Teachers and More in Next 10 Years, Making Humans Unnecessary 'for Most Things'
articles.author: Bailey Richards
articles.summary: Bill Gates believes AI will replace doctors, teachers, mental health professionals and more professionals within the next 10 years. The Microsoft co-founder appeared on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon to promote his debut memoir Source Code. Gates is optimistic about the future of AI, especially with regards to health and climate.

In the food industry, sensory evaluation is an essential yet rigorous and costly process. Human bias and sensory fatigue often prove challenging.

articles.title: New guidelines allow public figure images, controversial symbols
articles.author: News Desk
articles.summary: OpenAI has changed its content moderation policy and allows ChatGPT to generate images of public figures, controversial symbols, and racial features upon user request. Previously, the company restricted such content due to concerns over potential harm and controversy. The policy revision places OpenAI in line with other tech giants like Meta and X, which relaxed their content restrictions in response to debates over AI censorship.

articles.title: Next Phase: Intuitive AI That Attempts To Mimic The Human Psyche
articles.author: Joe McKendrick
articles.summary: Next frontier of AI may be 'emotional AI' - systems that recognize, interpret and respond to human emotions beyond just sentiment analysis. Emotional AI may become one of the most significant cultural turning points of our time. AI will reach a level of intelligence so far beyond human cognition it will no longer be comprehensible to us.

articles.title: Breakpoint: The rise of technopaganism: The gods of technology, demons and all
articles.author: John Stonestreet
articles.summary: In an interview with Bari Weiss, Bryan Johnson discussed "how not to die" and his view on artificial intelligence. Johnson's comments reflect a worldview that integrates technology and spirituality. For technophiles, technology takes on the role and functions of God in the universe, from basic provision to keeping humanity safe from disasters. Some in the tech world believe they are creating new forms of superintelligent, "godlike" sentient life.

articles.title: Kite AI Soars Past 546 Million Agent Calls and 4 Million Users on Testnet Phase 1
articles.author: Chainwire
articles.summary: Kite AI's recently launched Testnet v1 has processed over 546 million agent calls, averaging 11.4 million calls daily since it became public in February. 32 million transactions executed and onboarded 4 million users, including 2 million unique AI users. articles.title: 14 Ways AI And Robotics Are Quietly Taking Over The Restaurant Industry

articles.summary: AI and robotics are revolutionizing the restaurant industry. From cooking to customer service, technology is quietly transforming how restaurants operate. articles.title: Bill Gates Exposes the Frightening Future of AI
articles.author: Sarah Arnold
articles.summary: Bill Gates predicts that artificial intelligence will replace doctors and teachers within the next 10 years. He also predicts that by 2035 and beyond, 'great medical advice and great tutoring' will become widespread through AI. However, AI will not replace jobs in the entertainment industry, but in manufacturing, transportation, and agriculture.

articles.author: abigail nussbaum
articles.summary: Silvia Park's debut novel, Luminous, is a meditation on the relationship between humans and robots. It's set in a future, unified Korea, during a heat wave. The main character Jun is a detective in the robot crimes department, a cop who gets called in when people's companion robots are abducted or destroyed.

articles.title: The Tech Fantasy That Powers A.I. Is Running on Fumes
articles.summary: The use cases for artificial intelligence across every domain of work and life have started to get silly fast. A.I. spits out meal plans with the right amount of macros, tells us when our calendars are overscheduled and helps write emails that no one wants. It has been useful for producing medical protocols and spotting patterns in radiology scans, but it requires people who know how to use it. Politicians promise to make policy that unleashes the power of artificial intelligence to do something.

articles.summary: Bill Gates predicts that artificial intelligence (AI) will reshape industries within the next decade. Businesses should prepare for an AI-driven future rather than fear it. AI-powered assistants, chatbots, and automation tools can take over repetitive tasks, allowing human employees to focus on more valuable, creative and complex work.

The robotics industry is projected to grow significantly over the next decade, driven by advancements in AI, automation, and space exploration.
